transportAdvice: Kampala has a network of minibus taxis (matatus) and motorcycle taxis (boda-bodas) that cover most areas, though traffic congestion can be severe; private taxis and ride-hailing services are widely available and recommended for tourists. Walking is practical in some central neighborhoods but less so across the city due to traffic and uneven infrastructure.

weather.description: Warm and partly dry with occasional showers as the short dry season transitions; generally pleasant for sightseeing.
One of the drier months of the year with warm temperatures and plenty of sunshine, good for outdoor activities.
Rain begins to increase as the long rainy season approaches, with warm temperatures and occasional afternoon showers.
Peak of the long rainy season with frequent heavy downpours, expect muddy roads and disrupted travel plans.
Continued heavy rainfall with overcast skies; outdoor activities can be disrupted and roads may flood.
Rainfall eases as the long rains wind down, with more sunshine returning and temperatures remaining comfortable.
A relatively dry and sunny month, one of the best times to visit with cooler evenings and clear skies.
Dry and warm with low humidity, excellent conditions for travel and outdoor exploration around the city.
The short rainy season begins with increasing afternoon showers, though mornings are often clear and warm.
One of the wettest months with persistent rain and high humidity; pack waterproof gear and plan for delays.
Heavy rains continue through November, making travel challenging; roads can become difficult to navigate.
Rainfall decreases toward the end of the month as the short dry season begins, with warmer and sunnier days returning.
